intro: Solanum dunalianum var. inerme, commonly known as the slender nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its small, white or greenish flowers are followed by berries that mature to a bright red color, containing the toxic seeds typical of the Solanum genus.
